• fade-up-on-scroll.js

  • ¶

    Applies a “fade up” animation when an object with the .js-fade-up-on-scroll class enters the viewport. Requires the JQuery Visible plugin to calculate object visibility.

    (function($) {
  "use strict";

  $(document).ready(function() {
  • ¶

    Cache all objects that we want to monitor so that we don”t have to keep checking the DOM.

        var allFades = $(".js-fade-up-on-scroll");
  • ¶

    We check each of the “fade” objects to see if its visible on the screen. If so, we add the .come-in CSS class to perform the animation.

        function applyFade() {
      allFades.each(function(i, el) {
        el = $(el);
        if(el.realVisible(true)) {
          el.addClass("come-in");
        }
      });
    }
  • ¶

    Perform a check on initial load, and then again whenever the user scrolls.

        applyFade();
    $(window).scroll(applyFade);
  });

})(jQuery);
